results.content:
The Good
- Lecturer teach you a lot of tools you can use for develop.
- Only focus on API so this really help me understand big picture. I can finish this course in two day and have basic knowledge to lead the team.

The Bad
- Lecturer did not increase font size. It really hard to look in iPad or laptop screen. I need another big monitor for his code.
- Some code seem to outdated. not work the same way in laravel 7.
- No installation on Mac and Linux.
- No deployment.

response.content:
Hello,
Thanks for your feedback. You are right about the font, I already take that into consideration in my current courses.
The course was not created with Laravel 7 but I adapted and added lectures to make it compatible with the latest versions with minor effort. Anyway, you can get in touch at any moment if needed.
Finally, the course is intended for RESTful APIs so the installation of tools in the local environment is not a requirement BUT all the used tools are cross-platform. About deployment once again, that is out of the scope of the course and is covered in a different course.
Best wishes :)

You can still learn some great things here, but beware that this course doesn't address some changes in Laravel post version 5.5 such as Laravel's now built-in 'API Resources'.  I couldn't get Spatie Fractal to work in my 5.8 project, so I used Resources instead.

response.content:

I usually still improving and maintaining the course, so the entire contents still being valid and functional with the latest versions of Laravel. In fact, I recommend using the latest one to follow the course. Thanks and best wishes :)

results.content: Juan is one of the best teachers on topics related to Laravel on Udemy - as far as I am concerned. This course is another shining example for that. He is well organised and the lectures are usually concise and concentrated on a single topic and the sections have a logical structure. He es very quick in responding to all your questions and his answers are insightful and to the point. There is only one intermittent problem - and that is his pronunciation of his English (his grammar is mostly good). But sometimes you completely miss a point because of the way he pronounces things. But this is really the only thing you can criticise in his courses - from a professional point of view he is above board and his experience with real-world projects is obvious.

results.content:
This is not just a course on developing a REST API. It offers much, much more as a deep dive into the Laravel framework itself. I'm around 40% in the course and am already blown away by the use of Traits, Model Factories, Implicit Model Binding, and a slew of other advanced features that you'd normally acquire over a few months of hard work. The English spoken could be better, and I wish the instructor didn't assume everyone will be on MySQL, but that's okay. Another point is that the section on OAuth, and Passport didn't seem beginner-friendly to me. While I was able to piece together my scattered knowledge and follow along, I couldn't shake off the feeling that it'd be hard for those coming across OAuth for the first time. Same goes for NPM, Vue.JS, etc., -- it's not possible to cover everything, I know, but I'm again wondering how many people will feel comfortable with that. 

However, credit where it's due. It's a unique, advanced-level course that has given me 100% confidence in creating RESTful APIs on my own. Mind-blowing course, overall!

response.content:
Thank you very much for the detailed review!
There are some sections that can be a little difficult to understand at the first time, but you will see how gradually after the time you starts getting the point easily. OAuth is one of the main topics for a RESTful API, but its different flows and grants can be a little confusing at the beginning. Just remember, that you can ask everything you need and I'll be glad to explain further details if required :).

Thanks and receive my best wishes.

results.content:
Very good and very clear course with step-by-step instructions. It is understandable without too much previous knowledge of Laravel as the trainer explains every step and piece of code in detail - although some Laravel experience does help. The trainer also explains his choices in 'infrastructure', for instance the programming tools he uses, why he uses a virtual machine etc in function of the application he is creating. So no unnecessary wizardry and endless side-steps such as 'normally you would do this but now I am going to use this or that exotic technique which will leave you completely baffled and show you what a great programmer I am'.
One small negative point would be that both the trainer and myself are not native english speakers, which makes it sometimes difficult to understand what he means. Sometimes this is funny ('booyer' instead of 'buyer') but sometimes it is confusing (is it 'PHP comment' or 'PHP command'; 'Pee-bottle-blah' = pivot table').
But all in all this is a great course because it combines different important aspects of your project that are otherwise difficult to find. One of the things that I find most compelling is that the topic of security is an integral part of this course, which is what it should be in any course on web applications (but sadly is not often the case).
So great course and great value for money. This will really help me create the API that I need for my next project.

results.content:
In terms of content, this course is terrific! Very comprehensive.

You begin immediately programming within the framework. However, I always prefer testing what has been done in short iterations. When being introduced to a new concept, the instructor will have you complete all lectures within the module before running and testing, allowing you to see the fruits of your labor. 

Overall, I was able to get a really solid understanding of design patterns, methodology, etc, and I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in learning more about PHP, Laravel, or Restful APIs.

results.content:
Good course on API implementation in Laravel. Please keep in mind that most of this class is written with Laravel 5.4 in mind, so you'll run into some incompatibilities with the current version of Laravel, which are solved through looking through the comments.

Juan is a good teacher, although in some parts he went a bit fast and in other parts his accent is sometimes pretty distracting (for example: buyer is not booyer).

results.content: Very nice and laconic course. Greate job done by JuanD MeGon! One of the best parts of this course - it is splitted on very short videos, which allow you to educatute yourself even if you have a lack of time. I highly recommend this course to whoever wants to upgrade his laravel coding skills. Definately will take another course of JuanD MeGon.
